info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 2:10PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A line of showers will bring gusty winds to portions of northwestern Lewis and Clark, southeastern Pondera, southern Liberty, southeastern Toole, eastern Teton, western Chouteau and northwestern Cascade Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 208 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Conrad to 6 miles northwest of Power to near Augusta. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph with a period of heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause a period of reduced visibility, which may make travel difficult. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Conrad, Choteau, Cascade, Fairfield, Valier, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Brady, The Knees, Augusta, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Power, Carter, Floweree, Pishkun Reservoir, Tiber Dam, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park and Ulm. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
